name: Sukta - 156
description: Agni (lord of divine will) is the guide in the paths, He is asked to remove the Panis (subconscient traffickers)

name: Sukta - 157
description: The seer invites the all-gods to the inner sacrifice for protection

name: Sukta - 158
description: The seer prays to Savitr (the Creator) and other gods to provide the truth-vision for the integral view of the world

name: Sukta - 159
description: The seer Shachi (power of Indra) has got control of Her lord Indra (divine mind) with the rise of the Sun of truth

name: Sukta - 160
description: The seer offers Soma-delight to Indra, who frees the Soma-givers of all griefs

name: Sukta - 161
description: The seer by His mental powers cures the aspirant and prays to the Gods for giving Him a fulfilled life

name: Sukta - 162
description: The prayer is for removing the evil powers which stop the new births, with the help of the divine forces

name: Sukta - 163
description: The prayer is for removing ailments of various centres in the body

name: Sukta - 164
description:
The prayer is for removing the evil dreams/imagination/formations, with the help of
the divine forces

name: Sukta - 165
description: The seer prays for the Kapota (pigeon, perhaps a kind of thought) to be auspicious (and if it is a messenger of falsehood, for it to be sent away)

name: Sukta - 166
description: The victory of the aspirant over the hostiles is described

name: Sukta - 167
description: Soma-delight is offered to Indra (lord of divine mind), for the victory over the hostiles

name: Sukta - 168
description: Vata or Vayu (the lord of the vital) is the traveller of midworld with His mighty life-energies

name: Sukta - 169
description: The seer seeks the nourishment of the herds of illuminations, the Angirasa victory is mentioned

name: Sukta - 170
description: Surya (Sun of infinite truth) is the source of the best light of all, He is the destroyer of Hostiles, he is the nourisher of all beings

name: Sukta - 171
description: indra (lord of divine mind) protects the movement of the seer, He renews his Yajna

name: Sukta - 172
description: The divine dawn comes and illumines the worlds which were in darkness of ignorance. The seer seeks Her nourishing illuminations

name: Sukta - 173
description: The seer seeks the establishment of a strong (inner) kingdom with the grace of the divine powers

name: Sukta - 174
description: The seer seeks the help of the divine powers in securing the (inner) kingdom

name: Sukta - 175
description: The seer prays for the press-stones (perhaps the force of aspiration in the mind and body) to release the Soma with the urging of Savita (divine creator)

name: Sukta - 176
description:
Ribhus (divine artisans) enjoy their dwelling in the field of matter.
Agni (lord of divine will) is invoked as the leader of the Yajna

name: Sukta - 177
description:
The Sun (of infinite truth) possess Maya (the
power of formation), He protects and moves about in the worlds of His creation

name: Sukta - 178
description: The seer invokes Tarkashya (the Puranic Garuda) who is the mighty victor in the battles, for the welfare of the aspirants

name: Sukta - 179
description: Indra (lord of divine mind) is invited to the sacrifice, the seer asks the aspirants to make appropriate self-offerings to Indra

name: Sukta - 180
description: Indra (lord of divine mind) is asked to destroy the hostiles and come to the sacrifice with His riches

name: Sukta - 181
description: The different Saman chants (with the equal rhythm of the vasts) are brought to the sacrifice from the hidden abodes and from the gods by the seers

name: Sukta - 182
description: The seer seeks protection and peace from Brihaspati (master of the soul-word)

name: Sukta - 183
description:
The husband and wife (perhaps soul and nature) approach each other for the birth of children
(perhaps new formations) with the blessings of the Creatrix

name: Sukta - 184
description: The Gods are asked to give form to the child in the womb (perhaps Agni, or the potential new realisations)

name: Sukta - 185
description: The Adityas (sons of the infinite consciousness) are invoked for protection from falsehoods and achieving the truth-light

name: Sukta - 186
description: The seer prays to Vata or Vayu (the lord of the vital) for a long and fulfilling life

name: Sukta - 187
description:
The seer prays to Agni (the lord of the divine will) to carry the aspirants beyond the realm of the
Hostiles

name: Sukta - 188
description: Agni is the jataveda (knower of all things born), he is asked to carry the offerings of the aspirants to the gods

name: Sukta - 189
description: The soul-word moves in the being with the life- energy, it carries the aspiration of the aspirant to the heights

name: Sukta - 190
description: The creation process is described - The Tapas (concentrated force) of the Supreme manifests the Truth, and then comes the night and the (lower) ocean and the force of time and lower triple worlds

name: Sukta - 191
description: The aspirants are asked to unite their aspirations in the divine will (Agni) and take part in a collective sacrifice for the manifestation of the Oneness

name: Sukta - 104
description: The seer calls upon the various gods (Indra, Agni etc.) to come and destroy all kinds of hostile forces and beings (Rakshas, Yatudhanas, forces symbolised through certain animals/birds etc.)

name: Kandah - 1
description: In this Kandah, there are mantras for various diseases, enemy destruction, childbirth, body confirmation, disease prevention, longevity etc.

name: Kandah - 2
description: The subject matter of this kandah is almost the same as that of the first kand. In this too, sin redemption, enemy destruction, longevity, Dashayanash, protection, strength-attainment, worm-bhanjan, Vishwakarma etc. have been explained.

name: Kandah - 3
description: In the third kand of Atharvaveda, hypnosis of the enemy‚Äôs army, establishment of self-rule, suitable king for the nation, enemy destruction, longevity, destruction of sorrows, commerce, agriculture, vegetation, peace, prosperity etc. have been said.

name: Kandah - 4
description: There is information related to Brahmavidya, Atmavidya, enemy destruction, gambling, disease prevention, sin redemption, army care, protection from insects, poisoning, coronation etc. in this case. Varun Dev is praised in this.

name: Kandah - 5
description: The special importance of the Brahmin caste has been explained in this episode. Apart from this, there are mantras related to enemy destruction, victory, freedom from leprosy, Brahmavidya, soul, self-defense, measures of all-destruction, freedom from diseases, pregnancy, fire.

name: Kandah - 6
description: In this Kand of Atharvaveda, the destruction of nightmares, the prosperity of food, the destruction of enemies, the removal of poison from snakes, the renunciation of jealousy, medicine ‚Äì knowledge, the destruction of sin, longevity, healing, water ‚Äì healing, fame, good luck, etc. have been discussed.

name: Kandah - 7
description: In its 7th episode, the soul, the divine, Shatrunash, Saraswati, Rashtrasabha, Savita, Vishnu, Papmochan, Agni, Dharma, Gau, Amrit etc. have been told.

name: Kandah - 8
description: In its 8th kand, there are mantras for longevity, destruction of enemies, cure for pregnancy, medicine, great God etc. In this, the number of alphabets of 7 verses of Rigveda has been told. This episode of the Atharva Veda is especially known for the mantra that conquers death.

name: Kandah - 9
description: There are mantras of Madhu Vidya, Kama, Shala, Rishabh, guest hospitality, cow, soul etc. in this episode. Here it has been talked about sweet behavior and education by the parents to their children.

name: Kandah - 10
description: In the 10th Kand of the Atharvaveda, there are mantras of Brahma, Sarpavishnivaran, Vijay, Manibandha, Brahmacharya, etc. In this, information related to the subject of Sanatan Brahma is obtained. It has total 10 suktas and 350 mantras.

name: Kandah - 11
description: In this kand, there are mantras of Brahma, Rudra, Prana, celibacy, sin redemption, spirituality, enemy removal etc. with the help of 11th Kand, we also come to know that the ancient sage had excellent knowledge of vehicles, aircraft, arts etc.

name: Kandah - 12
description: It has mantras of motherland, heaven, sky etc. Animals roaming on the land have special importance for agriculture. There are living beings of different colors, forms and voices living on this earth, for all of them the sage wishes for their happiness and prosperity in the spirit of ‚ÄúVasudhaiva Kutumbakam‚Äù.

name: Kandah - 13
description: Spirituality has been described in the 13th Kanda of Atharveda. Yogis meditate on Jagdishwar in the form of light and get his company and experience bliss. Seeing everyone equally, that God keeps nature regulated.

name: Kandah - 14
description: There is a mantra related to marriage in this kandah.

name: Kandah - 15
description: This Kand also describes spirituality like the 13th Kand. In this, the description of the spiritual episode, the glory of God etc. is found.

name: Kandah - 16
description: There are mantras for the removal of sorrows in this kand. This whole world is bound by sorrow. Man wants to get out of this sorrow and spend his life in the desire of happiness.

name: Kandah - 17
description: It contains mantras of Mohan, Vashikaran and Abhyudaya prayer.

name: Kandah - 18
description: The funeral ceremony is described in the 18th episode. (In this the rituals after death have been explained.)

name: Kandah - 19
description: A detailed description of astrology is found in the 19th Kanda of Atharvaveda. In this, the description of Yajnakarma, peace, longevity, fearlessness, protection, Brahma, horse, ego, manibandha, strength-attainment, destruction of diseases, herbs, night, Brahmayagya, Vedmata, Time etc. is found.

name: Kandah - 20
description: Its 20th Kand is the biggest Kand of Atharva Veda. Most of its mantras are taken from Rigveda. It also contains mantras of Samveda. Here mainly there are mantras of worship of Indra.

name: Kandah - 1
description: Kandah 1 has four important inner Yajnas namely Darshapurnamasa, Agnishtoma, Vajapeya and Rajasuya, the royal consecration. There are 8 Prapataka‚Äôs that are for new and full moon sacrifices, Soma sacrifice, rekindling of the Fire and the Rajasuya yajna

name: Kandah - 2
description: Kandah 2 is mainly Brahmana, dealing with Yajna‚Äôs, special sacrifices and some full moon sacrifices.

name: Kandah - 3
description: Kandah 3 is mainly a Brahmana, dealing with Yajna‚Äôs, Supplement to the Soma sacrifice and Optional and Occasional offerings

name: Kandah - 4
description: Kandah 4 is perhaps the most important one among the 7 Kandah‚Äôs. It contains the famous Litany Rudra, the shatarudriya. Its glory is praised in many Upanishads. It is an excellent exposition of the principle and practice of the inner yajna or internal yajna for attaining overall spiritual progress.

name: Kandah - 5
description: Kandah 5, preparation of the fire altar, placing of the fire in the fire-pan and some parts deal with Ashvamedha yajna.

name: Kandah - 6
description: Kandah 6 deals with exposition of the Soma sacrifice and exposition of the Dakshina and other offerings.

name: Kandah - 7
description: Kandah 7 is mainly Brahmana dealing with yajna‚Äôs (e.g., Ashvamedha yagna) or mantras.

name: Prapatak -1
description: This describes the darshapurnamasau which is a brief and simple yajna perfomed on new moon and full moon days.

name: Prapatak -2
description: This and next prapathakas, constiture the famous Agnishotama yaga for the deities Agni and Soma. For the ritualists this yajna involves animal sacrifice but the text itself does not mention the killing of animal explicitly.

name: Prapatak -3
description: Continuation of Agnishotama yaga for the deities Agni and Soma.

name: Prapatak -4
description: Continuation of Agnishotama yaga for the deities Agni and Soma.

name: Prapatak -5
description: This Prapatak has over 55 mantras from the Rigveda

name: Prapatak -6
description: This Prapatak offers several details on the inner yajna occurring in our subtle body

name: Prapatak -7
description: This Prapatak deals with the Vajapeya yajna whose aim is the protection (peya) of the penitude of the life-force (vaja). Vajapeya is the highest form of soma Yajna, involving the pressing of Soma"

name: Prapatak -8
description: This deals with Rajasuya yajna. This grand Vedic ceremony is a testament to the spiritual and temporal authority of a king, showcasing his prowess and dominion over his realm. In addition to being an external rite, the king will obtain the full powers only when he meditates and invokes the Divine.
